vacate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to leave a job or position so that it is available for someone else to do
vacate.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Clay will vacate the position on June 19.
vacate.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to leave a seat, room etc so that someone else can use it
vacate.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Guests must vacate their rooms by 11:00.
vacate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to leave a job, position etc
vacate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Mr Jones was elected to fill the board seat vacated by Mr Carlisle
vacate.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to officially cancel a decision made by a court of law
vacate.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The court vacated the compensation award and sent it for new hearings.
